location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from James Dow, Assistant Surgeon, Temporarily in Charge of the Residency, Bushire, to Lieutenant Henry Hardy, Commander of the Honourable Company Cruiser, the Teignmouth

mods.abstract: In this letter James Dow, Assistant Surgeon, temporarily in charge of the Residency, informs Lieutenant Henry Hardy that 117 camaleens [camelines] have been packed up and forwarded on the Honourable Company boat, the Jennet. In addition, Dow states that sixty gallons of vinegar have been sent on the same ship.
